meanings.definition: To eat or drink luxuriously or plentifully.
meanings.sent1: The family coshered on delicious food during the holiday.
meanings.sent2: They coshered on the buffet at the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat coshered on the treats left out on the table.
meanings.sent4: The team coshered on victory after winning the championship.
meanings.sent5: The guests coshered on the gourmet dishes at the wedding reception.

meanings.sent1: The king coshered his guests with a grand banquet.
meanings.sent2: They coshered their friends with a lavish dinner party.
meanings.sent3: The magician coshered the audience with a spectacular show.
meanings.sent4: The chef coshered the critics with an exquisite tasting menu.
meanings.sent5: The host coshered the visitors with an opulent spread of desserts.

meanings.sent1: The royal cosher was a grand celebration of abundance.
meanings.sent2: The annual cosher at the manor was a highlight of the season.
meanings.sent3: The birthday cosher was filled with laughter and joy.
meanings.sent4: The holiday cosher was a delightful gathering of family and friends.
meanings.sent5: The community cosher brought together people from all walks of life.
